api.paragraph: The API for this site is open and freely available, and is found at {apilink}
developers.code.paragraph: The code for both the frontend and the API is open. Find it at {repolink}.
developers.code.paragraph2: Feel free to open Issues if you find any technical issues on the site, or on the API.
analyze.description: Analyze one or more words in isolation
spellcheck.description: Run a spell check for one or multiple words
langmodellastupdated: The language model was last updated
title.tool.paradigm.lang.crk: Generating inflectional paradigms for Plains Cree
place: Giellatekno, UiT The Arctic University of Norway

introduction.tool.analyze.lang.kal:
Write or paste the words in the window, and press the "Send form" button.
The options "Analyze" gives all possible analyses, whereas the
(default) option "Disambiguate" gives only the analyses appropriate
for the given sentence. The program may also hyphenate the text for
you, or add syllable boundaries, in which case it will not give a
grammatical analysis. Choose "Hyphenate".
introduction.tool.analyze.type.nodepende:
Write or paste the words in the window, and press the "Analyze" or
"Reset" button.
The options "Analyze" gives all possible analyses, whereas the
(default) option "Disambiguate" gives only the analyses appropriate
for the given sentence. The program may also hyphenate the text for
you, or add syllable boundaries, in which case it will not give a
grammatical analysis. Choose "Hyphenate".
introduction.tool.analyze.type.nodisamb:
Copy text into the window below, and the program will give you all
possible morphological analyses of the wordforms in question.
introduction.tool.analyze.type.nohyph.la:
Write or paste the words in the window, and press the "Send form" button.
Note that the analyser still contains a handful of verbs.
introduction.tool.analyze.type.nohyph:
Copy text into the window below, and the program will give you all
possible morphological analyses of the wordforms in question. If you
choose Disambiguate, it will make an attempt at choosing the analysis
which suits the given context (warning: the development of the
disambiguation program hasn't really started yet).
introduction.tool.analyze:
Write or paste the words in the window, and press the "Analyze" or
"Reset" button.
The options "Analyze" gives all possible analyses, whereas the
(default) option "Disambiguate" gives only the analyses appropriate
for the given sentence. The program may also hyphenate the text for
you, or add syllable boundaries, in which case it will not give a
grammatical analysis. Choose "Hyphenate".
introduction_p2.tool.analyze.lang.ciw: Some of the verbs included so far are: anwebi, aadizooke, bangishino, biindige, bimaadizi, gaasikanaabaagawe, gashkendamo, giigoonyike, giiwe, izhaa, jiibaakwe, maajaa, minikwe, wiisini, minomaagwad, gozigwan. Some of the nouns are: inini, ikwe, makwa, mitig, aanakwad, zaaga'igan, miikana, ziibi, makak, abwi, baabaa, maamaa, gosis, daanis, mishoomis.
introduction_p2.tool.analyze.lang.crk: You may also convert text from the Latin alphabet to syllabics or vice versa. Choose "Latin letters to syllabics" or "Syllabics to Latin letters"
introduction_p2.tool.analyze.lang.ipk: You may also convert Iñupiaq text from the 8-bit IñupiaQ Dictionary encoding to Unicode (if your Iñupiaq text contains some of the letters e, f, x, b, you need to do this). Choose "Convert".
introduction_p2.emph:
kra,
i.e. "ĸ" (Unicode U+0138), but since some users may not have support for it, the
conversion tool will translate non-initially written capital K as if it was kra. Choose "Convert".
introduction.tool.generate:
Write the word and grammatical specification
in the window, and press the "Generate" or "Reset"
button.
introduction.tool.placenames: Write the place name in Saami, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish. If the answer contains a name in parentheses, then this name is the name of the municipality in question.  Our sources are Statens Kartverk (SK), Saami Parliament in Sweden (SvSt), Pekka Sammallahti "Saami-suoma sátnegirji" (PS) and Saami Atlas by H.R. Mathisen (SA).
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.bxr: Write a Buriat word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. The program only works for a couple of nouns.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.ciw: Write an Ojibwe word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. The program only works for a couple of verbs.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.cor: Write a Cornish word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.fao: Write a Faroese word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.fin: The Finnish paradigm generator does not work yet.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.fit: The Finnish paradigm generator does not work yet.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.fkv: The Kven paradigm generator does not work yet.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.ipk: Write a Inupiaq word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.kal: Write a Greenlandic word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.kpv: Впишите слова коми языка, и программа производит флективную парадигму
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.mhr: Write a Meadow Mari word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.mns: Write a Mansi word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.myv: Write a Erzya word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.rus: The Russian paradigm generator does not work yet.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.sjd:
Write a Kildin Saami word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
The program contains the words listed in the grammar appendix of Kuruch's dictionary.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.sje: Write a Pite Saami word and choose the part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm. Currently, the program contains most of the nouns and verbs found in the lexical database for Pite Saami (saami.uni-freiburg.de/psdp/pite-lex), which is regularly corrected, expanded and improved. This database is based on thePitesamisk ordbok samt stavningsregler (Samica 2, 2016, edited by J. Wilbur), but also includes a few other words added by Ann-Charlotte Sjaggo. It is still under development.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.sma: Write a South Saami word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.sme: Write a North Saami word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.smj: Write a Lule Saami word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.smn:
Write a Inari Saami word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
The program only contains the words in the appendix of Morottaja and Sammallahti, and it is still under
development.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.sms:
Write a Skolt Saami word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
The program contains several thousand words from Itkonen, Moshnikoff, Sammallahti and modern social media.
If you notice mistakes, please contact us at Giellatekno.
introduction.tool.paradigm.lang.udm:
Write a Udmurt word and choose part of speech, and the program will generate the whole paradigm.
The program contains thousands of words from the dictionaries by Saarinen et al, for instance.
introduction.tool.paradigm:
Skriv basisforma av ordet og vel ordklasse, og programmet vil generere heile paradigmet
for ordet.
usage.lang.ciw: The analyser uses the Double Vowel (Fiero) system.
usage.lang.crk: You may use both circumflex (â) and macron (ā) in order to mark long vowel.
usage.lang.mns: Write the word in ordinary Mansi orthography. You may also write the words without length marks.
usage.lang.sjd: Write the word in Kildin Saami orthography. Note that we use Cyrillic Characters also for the Latin-looking ones. The program uses the 1985 orthography.
usage.lang.sje: The program accepts both Norwegian æ andø and Swedishä andö.
usage.lang.sma: The program accepts both i and the South Saami characterï and both Norwegianæ, ø and Swedishä, ö
usage.lang.sme: Write The Saami special letters as usual. If you don't have a Saami keyboard, you may write "á, č, đ, ŋ, š, ŧ, ž" as a1, c1, d1, n1, s1, t1, z1.
usage.lang.smj:
You may use the ordinary Lule Saami characters, the (official) ŋ, or older ń, ñ, and the program
understands both äö and æø.
usage.lang.smn: Write the word in ordinary Inari Saami orthography.
usage.lang.sms: Write the word in ordinary Skolt Saami orthography.
example.tool.generate.lang.cor: In order to get a Cornish wordform, write baseform+tags.
example.tool.generate.lang.crk: In order to get e.g. atimwak, writeatim+N+AN+Pl, and in order to getkiwicihikonaw, writewicih+V+TA+Ind+Prs+3Sg+12PlO
example.tool.generate.lang.fin: In order to get e.g. joella, writejoki+N+Sg+Ade
example.tool.generate.lang.fit: In order to get e.g. joela, writejoki+N+Sg+Ade
example.tool.generate.lang.fkv: In order to get e.g. jovella, writejoki+N+Sg+Ade
example.tool.generate.lang.ipk: In order to get e.g. iglum, writeiglu+N+Rel+Sg
example.tool.generate.lang.kal: In order to get e.g. illup, writeillu+N+Rel+Sg
example.tool.generate.lang.kpv: In order to get e.g. кывлы, writeкыв+N+Sg+Dat
example.tool.generate.lang.mhr: In order to get e.g. олмам, writeолма+N+Acc
example.tool.generate.lang.mns: In order to get e.g. улят, writeуля+N+Sg+Loc
example.tool.generate.lang.rus: In order to get e.g. тигров, writeтигр+N+Msc+Pl+Acc
example.tool.generate.lang.sme: In order to get e.g. viesus, writeviessu+N+Sg+Loc.
example.tool.generate.lang.smj: In order to get e.g. gádov, writegáhtot+V+Ind+Prs+Sg1. Forelluj andmuv, writeællo+N+Sg+Ill andmån+Pron+Pers+Sg1+Acc.
example.tool.generate.lang.sms: In order to get e.g. kuäʹđest, writekueʹtt+N+Sg+Loc.
example.tool.generate.lang.yrk: In order to get e.g. тэхэна, writeты+N+Sg+Loc
example.tool.generate: Write lemma + grammatical analysis in order to get the wordform.
instruction.tool.generate: Type the word form and grammatical code:
endtext:
The program is under construction. If you notice errors of
any kind, please report them to giellatekno@uit.no.
end.lang.sma:
The program is under construction. If you notice errors of
any kind, please report them to
The Centre for Saami language technology.
end.lang.smj: The Lule Saami analysis program contains close to 20000 base forms (from Spiiks grammar, Nystø/Johnsens textbook Sámásta, and above all from Kintels and also Korhonens dictionaries), but much work still remains to be done. If you find errors or omissions, please report back to us in the Saami language technology team.
end.lang.smn:
The program is in a test phase and it, contains only some words from the grammar
section of the Sammallahti - Morottaja dictionary. If you notice errors of
any kind, please report them to The Centre for Saami language technology.
end.lang.sms:
The program contains several thousand words from Itkonen,
 Moshnikoff, Sammallahti and modern social media.
 If you notice errors of
any kind, please report them to The Centre for Saami language technology.
end.tool.analyze: The program is not finished. If you notice errouneous forms or analyses, please contact Giellatekno.
introduction.lang.crk: The Plains Cree tools represent work by AltLab at U of Alberta and Giellatekno at UiT.
introduction.lang.est: The Estonian analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.gle: The Irish analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.izh: The Ingrian analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.kca: The Khanty analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.liv: The Livonian analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.mdf: The Moksha analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.mrj: The Hill Mari analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.nio: The Nganasan analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.nob: The Norwegian Bokmål analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.olo: The Olonetsian analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.vep: The Veps analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.vro: The Võro analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.vot: The Votic analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.yrk: The Nenets analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.bxr: The Buriat analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.ciw: The Ojibwe analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.cor:
This is the home page of the Cornish parser project. The project
    is still in its embryonic phase. You will be able to analyse a
    handful of words only, but we will enlarge the base
    eventually. The parser is based upon the Single Written Form.
introduction.lang.fao: The Faroese tools combine a morphological and morphophonological transducer with the set of lexemes found in Føroysk orðabók into a grammatical parser for Faroese. The morphological coverage is quite good (with some lacunas for strong verbs and adjectives), but the syntactic analyser is in its infancy.
introduction.lang.fin: The Finnish analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.fit: The Meänkieli analyser is just in the making.
introduction.lang.ipk: This is the home page of the Iñupiaq parser project. The project is still in its embryonic phase. Our Iñupiaq analysers covers the basic inflectional grammar, and the central vocabulary (but very few derivational affixes!). We will enlarge the base eventually. We also offer a convertion from the Interactive IñupiaQ Dictionary encoding to Unicode.
introduction.p: A new version of the Greenlandic spell checker and hyphenation tools for the Windows version of the MSOffice suite (KUKKUNIIAAT ver. 2.0) is nowready for download. It is free of charge and can be downloadedhere.
introduction.lang.koi: The Komi Permyak analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction.lang.kpv: The Komi analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction.lang.mhr: The Meadow Mari analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction.lang.mns: The Mansi analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction.lang.myv: The Erzya analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction.lang.rus: The Russian analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction.lang.udm: The Udmurt analyser gives a morphological and syntactical analysis of most words in running text.
introduction.lang.sjd:
The Kildin Saami analyser only contains a handful of words yet. The
    number generator works, though.
introduction.lang.sje: The Pite Saami analyser and generator currently work for most of the nouns and verbs found in the lexical database for Pite Saami (saami.uni-freiburg.de/psdp/pite-lex), which is regularly corrected, expanded and improved. This database is based on thePitesamisk ordbok samt stavningsregler (Samica 2, 2016, edited by J. Wilbur), but also includes a few other words added by Ann-Charlotte Sjaggo. The orthography used is based on the orthography presented atsaami.uni-freiburg.de/psdp/stavningsregler/. This is still a preliminary, test version, and is under on-going development.
introduction.lang.smj:
For Lule Saami, our morphological tools are quite robust. Analysing
    words in context (disambiguation and syntax), however, is still in
    the beginning.
introduction.lang.smn:
The Inari Saami analyser gives the morphological analysis of
    over 92 % of the words in running text,
    and gives a rough syntactic analysis of sentences.
introduction.lang.sms:
The Skolt Saami analyser gives the morphological analysis of
    over 70 % of the words in running text, but work has not yet
    started on syntactic analysis of sentences.
analysis_text.lang.izh: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.kca: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.liv: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.mdf: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.mrj: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.nio: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.olo: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.vep: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.yrk: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.ipk: Analyse words (no syntactic analysis). You may paste in text, and the program gives all possible analyses for each wordform. You may also convert text from Interactive IñupiaQ Dictionary encoding to Unicode.
analysis_text.lang.kal:
Analyse, disambiguate and hyphenate text. The program also gives
    IPA representation, and it converts from Kleinschmidt (pre-1973)
    to modern orthography.
analysis_text.lang.sjd: Analyse a handful of words only.
analysis_text.lang.sme:
Analyse, disambiguate and hyphenate text, and give dependency
    analysis. Convert text into IPA.
analysis_text.lang.crk: Analyses text. Converts text between latin letters and syllabics.
paradigm_text: Generates paradigms of different sizes for any word.
paradigm_text.lang.ipk: Generates paradigms of different sizes for the core vocabulary.
paradigm_text.lang.mns: Generates paradigms of different sizes for the core vocabulary.
paradigm_text.lang.sjd:
The paradigm generator works formally, but the paradigms given often contain
    more errors than correct forms. At the moment, the generator is on the
    net for internal delvelopment purposes.
paradigm_text.lang.sje: Generates paradigms of different sizes for the core vocabulary.
paradigm_text.lang.smn: Generates paradigms of different sizes for adjectives, nouns and verbs.
paradigm_text.lang.sms: Generates paradigms of different sizes for adjectives, nouns and verbs.
generator_text: Generates wordforms using lemma and grammatical tags.
numerals_text: Write a number (ex. 123), and get a number word.
numerals_text.lang.hdn: Write a number (ex. 74), and get a number word.
numerals_text.lang.bxr: There is still no numeral generator for Buriat.
numerals_text.lang.ciw: There is still no numeral generator for Ojibwe.
numerals_text.lang.cor: There is still no numeral generator for Cornish.
numerals_text.lang.fao: There is still no numeral generator for Faroese.
numerals_text.lang.ipk: There is still no numeral generator for Iñupiaq.
numerals_text.lang.kal: There is still no numeral generator for Greenlandic.
numerals_text.lang.rus: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text.lang.sma: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text.lang.sme: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text.lang.smj: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text.lang.sjd: There is still no numeral generator for
numerals_text.lang.udm: There is still no numeral generator for Udmurt.
nds_text: Interactive online dictionary. Understands inflected words and offers inflection paradigms. With corpus search.
webdictionaries_text: Look up words in an online web dictionary. The words are presented as a list, which can be useful if you don't know how to spell the word.
korp_text: Search for words and grammatical patterns in text collections (does not work in Internet Explorer).
placenames_text: Write placenames in Norwegian or Finnish, and get the corresponding place name in Saami, or vice versa.
risten_text: This is a development of the old risten.no
oahpa_text.lang.sme: Interactive programs for glossary and vocabulary training, and for practicing dialogues.
oahpa_text.lang.sma: Interactive programs for glossary and vocabulary training, and for practicing number date and time expressions.
oahpa_text.lang.sjd: Interactive programs for glossary training, and for practicing number date and time expressions. The program is still just a demo version.
oahpa_text.lang.smn: Interactive programs for glossary training, and for practicing number date and time expressions. The program is still just a demo version.
oahpa_text.lang.sms: Interactive programs for glossary training, and for practicing number date and time expressions, with extensive morphology in verbs and nouns. The contextual practice is still much of a demo version.
crkoahpa_text.lang.crk: Interactive programs for glossary and vocabulary training, and for practicing number date and time expressions. This is a very restricted demo version.
tts_text: The computer reads the text to you.
gielese_text: Learn words – the program contains audio files and photos
visl_text: Interactive programs for training grammar skills.
mt: Machine Translation from North Saami to Norwegian
mt_text: Paste text or translate web pages.
mt2: Machine Translation between different Saami languages
mt2_text: Paste text or translate web pages. These programs are still on a beta stadium.
other.lang.crk: AltLab at U of Alberta and Giellatekno at UiT. AltLab work is financed by SSHRC Canada
other.lang.ipk: The project is a joint project between Grønlands Sprognævn (Oqaasileriffik) and the University of Tromsø.
other.lang.izh: The Ingrian tools represent work by Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other.lang.kal: The project is a joint project between Grønlands Sprognævn (Oqaasileriffik) and the University of Tromsø.
other.lang.kca: The Khanty tools represent work by Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other.lang.koi: The Komi Permyak tools are in the making. They represent a joint project between FU-lab, Giellatekno and Jack Rueter.
other.lang.kpv: The Komi tools are in the making. They represent a joint project between Giellatekno and Jack Rueter. The lexicon of the analysers are based upon Jack Rueter's Komi-Finnish-English dicionary.
other.lang.liv: The Livonian tools represent work by Renate Blumberga and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other.lang.mdf: The Moksha tools represent work by Eeva Herrala, Aleksandr Feoktistov, Merja Salo and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The present work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other.lang.mhr: The Meadow Mari tools are in the making. They represent a joint project between Giellatekno and Jorma Luutonen. The lexicon of the analysers are based upon Arto Moisios Mari-Finnish dicionary.
other.lang.mrj: The Hill Mari tools represent work by Julia Kuprina and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other.lang.myv: The Erzya tools are in the making. They represent a joint project between Giellatekno and Jack Rueter. The lexicon of the analysers are based on dictionary work on Erzya by many authors.
other.lang.nio: The Nganasan tools represent work by Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other.lang.olo: The Olonetsian tools represent work by Timo Rantakaulio and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other.lang.rmf: The work on the Finnish Romani tools has just started. The analysers are put here for testing purposes.
other.lang.sjd: The work on the Kildin Saami tools has just started. The analysers are put here for testing purposes.
other.lang.sje: The Pite Saami tools are available here for testing purposes, and without any guarantee for accuracy. These are currently under development by Joshua Wilbur (with significant technical support from Giellatekno) as part of a project on Pite Saami syntactic structures at theFreiburg Research Group in Saami Studies. Thanks to Ann-Charlotte Sjaggo and Trond Trosterud for setting up the initial framework.
other.lang.vep: The Veps tools represent work by Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
other.lang.yrk: The Nenets tools represent work by Tapani Salminen, Sven-Erik Soosaar and Jack Rueter, in cooperation with Giellatekno. The present work is financed by the Kone Foundation and the University of Tromsø
